title: Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: The Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for a reaction can be calculated using the equation: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS.

title: Components of the Equation
text:
Identify the values given in the problem:
- Molar enthalpy of fusion (ΔH) $$=$$ $$5.65$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- Molar entropy of fusion (ΔS) $$=$$ $$28.9$$ $$ rac{J}{K·mol}$$
- Temperature (T) $$=$$ $$170$$ K

Note: Convert units of ΔH from $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$ to $$ rac{J}{mol}$$ for consistency.

title: Unit Conversion
text: Convert the molar enthalpy of fusion from $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ to $$\frac{J}{mol}$$. Remember that $$1$$ kJ $$=$$ $$1000$$ J.

title: Calculation Setup
text: Substitute the given values into the Gibbs free energy equation:\nΔG $$=$$ $$(5.65$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ × 1000) - (170 K × $$28.9$$ J/(K·mol))\nSimplify the equation by first multiplying (170 K × $$28.9$$ J/(K·mol)).

title: Final Calculation
text: Complete the equation:\n$$ΔG=5650$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ - $$4913$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$.\nCalculate ΔG for $$3.60$$ mol ammonia.
